summary.para: Accepts data about a new window that is attempting to display and determines whether that window should be allowed to open based on the user's preferences.

param.name: pszUrl
param.para: A pointer to a buffer that contains the URL of the content that will be displayed in the new window.

param.name: pszName
param.para: A pointer to a buffer that contains the name of the new window. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: pszUrlContext
param.para: A pointer to a buffer that contains the URL that has issued the command to open the new window.

param.name: pszFeatures
param.para: A pointer to a buffer that contains the feature string for the new window. This value can be NULL.

param.name: fReplace
param.para: A boolean value used when the new content specified in pszUrl is loaded into the existing window instead of creating a new one. TRUE if the new document should replace the current document in the history list; FALSE if the new document should be given a new entry.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: A flag or flags from the enumeration that provide situational information about the call to open the new window. This value can be 0 if no flags are needed.

param.name: dwUserActionTime
param.para: The tick count when the last user action occurred. To find out how long ago the action occurred, call and compare the result with the value in this parameter.

returns.para: Returns standard error codes, including the following:

description.para: When you implement for a hosted WebBrowser control, this value instructs the WebBrowser control to use the default implementation.

summary.para: Exposes a method that determines whether a window that is launched by another window should be displayed or blocked, allowing control of pop-up windows.

remarks.para: Implement INewWindowManager when your application hosts a WebBrowser control and you want to include pop-up management functionality.

When you implement INewWindowManager, you can override some or all of the Windows Internet Explorer pop-up blocking logic. To use the default Internet Explorer pop-up blocking logic, implement to return E_FAIL. This instructs the WebBrowser control to use the default Internet Explorer implementation. Alternately, the application hosting the WebBrowser control can call CoInternetSetFeatureEnabled with the FEATURE_WEBOC_POPUPMANAGEMENT flag for the same result.
